english: to take on (a risk); to dare (to do). Often collocates with <ruby>危険<rt>きけん</rt></ruby>.
japanese_example: <ruby>危険<rt>きけん</rt></ruby>を<ruby>冒<rt>おか</rt></ruby>して<ruby>山<rt>やま</rt></ruby>に<ruby>登<rt>のぼ</rt></ruby>った。
english_example: I took a risk and climbed the mountain.

english: cannot take on (a risk); cannot dare (to). This is the potential + negative of <ruby>冒<rt>おか</rt></ruby>す (not causative; causative would be <ruby>冒<rt>おか</rt></ruby>させる).
japanese_example: そんな<ruby>危険<rt>きけん</rt></ruby>は<ruby>冒<rt>おか</rt></ruby>せない。
english_example: I can’t take that kind of risk.

english: graduation (from a school). Contrast with <ruby>授業<rt>じゅぎょう</rt></ruby> = 'class/lesson'.
japanese_example: <ruby>来年<rt>らいねん</rt></ruby><ruby>大学<rt>だいがく</rt></ruby>を<ruby>卒業<rt>そつぎょう</rt></ruby>します。
english_example: I will graduate from university next year.

english: class; lesson (at school). Contrast with <ruby>卒業<rt>そつぎょう</rt></ruby> = 'graduation'.
japanese_example: <ruby>今日<rt>きょう</rt></ruby>の<ruby>授業<rt>じゅぎょう</rt></ruby>は<ruby>九時<rt>くじ</rt></ruby>からです。
english_example: Today’s class starts at 9.

english: half-fledged; inexperienced; not yet fully competent. Used about skill/ability.
japanese_example: まだ<ruby>半人前<rt>はんにんまえ</rt></ruby>だから、もっと<ruby>練習<rt>れんしゅう</rt></ruby>が<ruby>必要<rt>ひつよう</rt></ruby>だ。
english_example: You’re still inexperienced, so you need more practice.

hiragana: はんにんまえまほうつかい
english: half-baked wizard; an inexperienced wizard. With no の, it’s treated as a compound noun: <ruby>半人前<rt>はんにんまえ</rt></ruby> + <ruby>魔法使<rt>まほうつか</rt></ruby>い.
japanese_example: <ruby>彼<rt>かれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby>半人前魔法使<rt>はんにんまえまほうつか</rt></ruby>いだが、<ruby>根性<rt>こんじょう</rt></ruby>はある。
english_example: He’s a half-baked wizard, but he has guts.

english: is not allowed; is not permitted. Pattern: Vては + いない (prohibition/denial). The は adds contrast/emphasis.
japanese_example: ここで<ruby>写真<rt>しゃしん</rt></ruby>を<ruby>撮<rt>と</rt></ruby>っては<ruby>許<rt>ゆる</rt></ruby>されてはいない。
english_example: Taking photos here is not permitted.

english: dung beetle. (Common name; literally something like 'poop-roller'.)
japanese_example: <ruby>動物園<rt>どうぶつえん</rt></ruby>でフンコロガシを<ruby>見<rt>み</rt></ruby>た。
english_example: I saw a dung beetle at the zoo.

english: is being changed into ~; has been changed into ~. Passive of <ruby>変<rt>か</rt></ruby>える: 変える → 変えられる; 〜ている shows ongoing state/result.
japanese_example: <ruby>水<rt>みず</rt></ruby>が<ruby>氷<rt>こおり</rt></ruby>に<ruby>変<rt>か</rt></ruby>えられている。
english_example: The water has been changed into ice.

english: tough; difficult; serious. Also used as an adverb meaning 'very' (context decides).
japanese_example: この<ruby>仕事<rt>しごと</rt></ruby>は<ruby>大変<rt>たいへん</rt></ruby>だ。
english_example: This job is tough.

english: to be afraid of ~ (showing fear). <ruby>怖<rt>こわ</rt></ruby>がる often describes observable fear (especially of others/animals/children).
japanese_example: <ruby>子<rt>こ</rt></ruby>どもが<ruby>犬<rt>いぬ</rt></ruby>を<ruby>怖<rt>こわ</rt></ruby>がっている。
english_example: The child is afraid of dogs.

english: precisely because of that; that’s exactly why. Stronger/more emphatic than だから.
japanese_example: <ruby>難<rt>むずか</rt></ruby>しい。だからこそ、やる<ruby>価値<rt>かち</rt></ruby>がある。
english_example: It’s difficult. That’s exactly why it’s worth doing.

english: together; jointly.
japanese_example: <ruby>明日<rt>あした</rt></ruby><ruby>一緒<rt>いっしょ</rt></ruby>に<ruby>行<rt>い</rt></ruby>こう。
english_example: Let’s go together tomorrow.

english: to try to do ~; to be about to do ~. Intention/attempt right before the action.
japanese_example: ドアを<ruby>開<rt>あ</rt></ruby>けようとした。
english_example: I tried to open the door.

english: did not try to ~; had no intention of ~. Negative of 〜ようとする (no attempt / refusal / lack of intent).
japanese_example: <ruby>彼<rt>かれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby>謝<rt>あやま</rt></ruby>ろうとしなかった。
english_example: He didn’t even try to apologize.

english: several weeks; a few weeks. <ruby>数<rt>すう</rt></ruby> here means 'several' (not an exact count).
japanese_example: <ruby>数週間<rt>すうしゅうかん</rt></ruby>で<ruby>結果<rt>けっか</rt></ruby>が<ruby>出<rt>で</rt></ruby>ます。
english_example: You’ll get results in a few weeks.

english: low; short; (of voice) deep/low. Common: <ruby>低<rt>ひく</rt></ruby>い<ruby>声<rt>こえ</rt></ruby>.
japanese_example: <ruby>彼<rt>かれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby>低<rt>ひく</rt></ruby>い<ruby>声<rt>こえ</rt></ruby>で<ruby>話<rt>はな</rt></ruby>した。
english_example: He spoke in a low voice.

english: fabrication; made-up story; something said without basis. Often with <ruby>言<rt>い</rt></ruby>う.
japanese_example: それは<ruby>出<rt>で</rt></ruby>まかせだよ。
english_example: That’s completely made up.

english: plump; stout; portly (often about body shape). Nuance: noticeably chubby/heavyset.
japanese_example: でっぷりした<ruby>猫<rt>ねこ</rt></ruby>が<ruby>寝<rt>ね</rt></ruby>ている。
english_example: A plump cat is sleeping.

japanese: 働かせる限り速く働かした
hiragana: はたらかせるかぎりはやくはたらかした
english: made (someone/something) work as fast as possible; pushed to the limit. <ruby>限<rt>かぎ</rt></ruby>り = 'as much as possible / to the limit'; <ruby>働<rt>はたら</rt></ruby>かせる is causative.
japanese_example: <ruby>馬<rt>うま</rt></ruby>を<ruby>働<rt>はたら</rt></ruby>かせる<ruby>限<rt>かぎ</rt></ruby>り<ruby>速<rt>はや</rt></ruby>く<ruby>走<rt>はし</rt></ruby>らせた。
english_example: I made the horse run as fast as it possibly could.

english: to run away; to bolt; to break into flight. Often implies sudden escape.
japanese_example: こわくて<ruby>家<rt>いえ</rt></ruby>から<ruby>逃<rt>に</rt></ruby>げ<ruby>出<rt>だ</rt></ruby>した。
english_example: I got scared and ran out of the house.

english: to enjoy; to take pleasure in.
japanese_example: <ruby>旅行<rt>りょこう</rt></ruby>を<ruby>楽<rt>たの</rt></ruby>しんだ。
english_example: I enjoyed the trip.

english: contact; communication (with someone). Often: <ruby>連絡<rt>れんらく</rt></ruby>する = to contact.
japanese_example: あとで<ruby>連絡<rt>れんらく</rt></ruby>します。
english_example: I’ll contact you later.

english: to cut; to sever. Also used metaphorically (e.g., to hang up: <ruby>電話<rt>でんわ</rt></ruby>を<ruby>切<rt>き</rt></ruby>る).
japanese_example: <ruby>電話<rt>でんわ</rt></ruby>を<ruby>切<rt>き</rt></ruby>ってもいい？
english_example: Can I hang up?

english: to separate; to detach; to let go (physically). Not the 'to speak' <ruby>話<rt>はな</rt></ruby>す.
japanese_example: <ruby>手<rt>て</rt></ruby>を<ruby>離<rt>はな</rt></ruby>さないで。
english_example: Don’t let go of my hand.

english: was disconnected; was cut off; was separated. Passive of <ruby>切<rt>き</rt></ruby>り<ruby>離<rt>はな</rt></ruby>す.
japanese_example: <ruby>島<rt>しま</rt></ruby>は<ruby>本土<rt>ほんど</rt></ruby>から<ruby>切<rt>き</rt></ruby>り<ruby>離<rt>はな</rt></ruby>された。
english_example: The island was cut off from the mainland.

english: to tease; to make fun of (lightly or annoyingly, depending on context).
japanese_example: <ruby>人<rt>ひと</rt></ruby>をからかうのはやめて。
english_example: Stop teasing people.

english: I don’t care; it doesn’t matter; whatever. Expresses indifference. (どうでもよい is more formal; meaning is essentially the same.)
japanese_example: どっちでもいいよ。どうでもいい。
english_example: Either is fine. I don’t care.

english: came to not care anymore; became indifferent. 〜くなる = 'to become (state)'.
japanese_example: <ruby>最近<rt>さいきん</rt></ruby>は<ruby>勝<rt>か</rt></ruby>ち<ruby>負<rt>ま</rt></ruby>けがどうでもよくなった。
english_example: Lately, I’ve stopped caring about winning or losing.

english: even just (do) ~; if only ~ (minimum condition). Pattern: verb stem + さえ. Meaning: 'even just X is enough / even X (unexpectedly minimal)'.
japanese_example: <ruby>君<rt>きみ</rt></ruby>が<ruby>来<rt>き</rt></ruby>さえすれば、うれしい。
english_example: If you would just come, I’d be happy.

english: rival; nemesis; arch-enemy (often long-standing, fate-like rivalry).
japanese_example: <ruby>彼<rt>かれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby>宿敵<rt>しゅくてき</rt></ruby>と<ruby>再戦<rt>さいせん</rt></ruby>した。
english_example: He fought his nemesis again.
